extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addPokemon(Pokemon newPokemon)
      Adds the given pokemon to the trainer's party Returns true if the pokemon could be added, false otherwise.
      boolean allFainted()
      Returns true if all the pokemon besides the party leader have no remaining health, and returns false otherwise.
      java.util.ArrayList<Pokemon> getParty()
      Returns the trainer's party
      Pokemon getPartyLeader()
      Returns the trainer's party leader (the first pokemon in the party, meaning the one that will be in battle)
      Pokemon getPokemonAt(int index)
      Retuns the pokemon at the given index of the party
      void healParty()
      Heals all the pokemon in the party and also resets each pokemon's StatStages.
      boolean removePokemon(int index)
      Removes the pokemon at the given index from the party Returns true if the pokemon could be removed, false otherwise.
      void setParty(java.util.ArrayList<Pokemon> newParty)
      Sets the trainer's party to the given ArrayList of pokemon
      void swapPokemonAt(int index1, int index2)
      Swaps the position of the pokemons at the given indexes of the party
      void swapPokemonWith(int index, Pokemon newPokemon)
      Replaces the pokemon at the given index of the party with the given pokemon

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trainer

        public Trainer()
        Constructor of Trainer. It initializes the players party with some pokemons. This will be the player's default pokemons.

        Returns:
